reduces the risk of sudden infant 
death. Do not begin to give a 
dummy until breastfeeding is 
well established, usually when 
your baby is around one month 
old. Stop giving the dummy 
when your baby is between six 
and12 months old. If possible 
remove the dummy when the 
baby falls asleep. 
Continuous sucking on a 
dummy for long periods may 
effect	tooth	development	or	
speech later on.
Monitors
Normal healthy babies do not 
need a breathing monitor.
